channel.title: math.GN updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GN updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Q-Sets, \Delta-Sets, and L-Spaces
item.description: arXiv:2501.08298v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: The question whether there is a Lindelof Q-set space or Lindelof $\Delta$-set space is considered. We show that J. Moore's ZFC $L$-space is not a Q-set space in ZFC and, assuming all Aronszajn trees are special, it is not a $\Delta$-set space.
item.dc:creator: Pourya Memarpanahi, Paul Szeptycki

item.title: On $z^\circ$-ideals and annihilator ideals
item.description: arXiv:2505.13647v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: For $a\in R$, let $P_a$ denote the intersection of all minimal prime ideals of $R$ containing $a$. An ideal $I$ of a ring $R$ is called a $z^{\circ}$-ideal if $P_a\subseteq I$ for all $a\in I$. In this paper, we first investigate the class of $z^{\circ}$-ideals in non-commutative rings. We provide characterizations of $z^{\circ}$-ideals in 2-by-2 generalized triangular matrix rings, full and upper triangular matrix rings, and semiprime rings. Next, we explore new properties of the lattice $rAnn(id(R))$, the set of right annihilator ideals of $R$. We prove that $rAnn(id(R))$ forms a frame when $R$ is semiprime and a coherent frame when $R$ is a reduced ring. Furthermore, we characterize the smallest (resp., largest) right annihilator ideal contained in an ideal $I$ of an $SA$-ring $R$.
item.dc:creator: A. Taherifar

item.title: Embedding of a Discrete Lattice Structure in a Smooth Manifold
item.description: arXiv:2501.02542v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: I propose a mathematical framework for embedding an unshaped discrete lattice $L$ on a smooth manifold $M$. This framework simplifies complex concepts in pure mathematics and physics by connecting discrete lattice structures with continuous geometric interpretations through practical embeddings.
item.dc:creator: Francesco D'Agostino
